intro: Pennantia corymbosa, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red bract-like flowers that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with a serrated margin. Pennantia corymbosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
